rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you. See [[WP:FIXNF]] and [[WP:10CR]]
rev.diff:
Line 72: Line 72:
==Third marriage: Duchess of Windsor==
==Third marriage: Duchess of Windsor==
â
[[Image:Wallis and Edward.jpg|thumb|The Windsors on their wedding day. Wallis was dressed in a "Wallis blue" [[Mainbocher]] [[wedding dress of Wallis Warfield|wedding dress]].]]
 
Wallis and Edward married one month later on 3 June 1937 at the ChÃ¢teau de CandÃ©, lent to them by [[Charles Bedaux]], who later worked actively for [[Nazi Germany]] in World War II.<ref>{{citation|first=Patrick|last=Howarth|title=George VI|publisher=Hutchinson|year=1987|page=73|isbn=0-091-71000-6}}</ref> The date would have been King [[George V of England|George V]]'s 72nd birthday; Queen [[Mary of Teck|Mary]] thought the wedding had been scheduled for then as a deliberate slight.<ref>Letter from Queen Mary to Queen Elizabeth, 21 May 1937, Royal Archives, QEQM/PRIV/RF, quoted in {{citation|last=Shawcross|first=William|authorlink=William Shawcross|title=Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother: The Official Biography|publisher=Macmillan|year=2009|isbn=9781405048590|page=422}}</ref> No member of the [[British Royal Family]] attended. The marriage produced no children. In November, Ernest Simpson married Mary Kirk.
Wallis and Edward married one month later on 3 June 1937 at the ChÃ¢teau de CandÃ©, lent to them by [[Charles Bedaux]], who later worked actively for [[Nazi Germany]] in World War II.<ref>{{citation|first=Patrick|last=Howarth|title=George VI|publisher=Hutchinson|year=1987|page=73|isbn=0-091-71000-6}}</ref> The date would have been King [[George V of England|George V]]'s 72nd birthday; Queen [[Mary of Teck|Mary]] thought the wedding had been scheduled for then as a deliberate slight.<ref>Letter from Queen Mary to Queen Elizabeth, 21 May 1937, Royal Archives, QEQM/PRIV/RF, quoted in {{citation|last=Shawcross|first=William|authorlink=William Shawcross|title=Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother: The Official Biography|publisher=Macmillan|year=2009|isbn=9781405048590|page=422}}</ref> No member of the [[British Royal Family]] attended. The marriage produced no children. In November, Ernest Simpson married Mary Kirk.
